transcript_chunks.text: for score I'm gonna give it a 4 out of five and looking and playing this game through a modern lens this game rocks like I think this game is is really dope playing re4 remake it feels like I am playing somewhat of a sequel to re2 remake that's really cool one away because they're taking a lot of those mechanics and a lot of that setup that they added in for re2 remake and early on as well and Leon as well right and it feels almost like a smoother transition than I imagined what you got from re2 to R3 to re4 but then also you have the same shift as well where this game is way more action heavy than re2 remake it's way longer than re2 remake um yeah there's a there's a lot of meat in this game and there's also just a lot of wackiness in the cutscenes I know that's probably true to form for that transition to re42 where Leon's doing backflips like almost feels like I'm watching Metal Gear Solid cutscenes versus what I got out of books yeah yeah a lot of what I got from from aria2 which I

transition to re42 where Leon's doing backflips like almost feels like I'm watching Metal Gear Solid cutscenes versus what I got out of books yeah yeah a lot of what I got from from aria2 which I think is fascinating
